agency.text: What events do we provide translators for?
agency.subtitle: We provide translators for events of any level of complexity and responsibility?

0.5: • excursions and accompanying guests around the city;

agency.prelevels: Depending on the qualifications of the translator, interpretation is divided into :

1.1: • basic (private negotiations) - professional translator (experience from 1 year);
1.2: • business (business negotiations) - an experienced translator (experience from 2-3 years);
1.3: • premium (public speaking) - premium translator (experience from 5-7 years in front of a large audience and cameras).
1.4: The cost also depends on the responsibility of interpretation and the qualifications of the translator.
1.5: The translator's transport time is also paid. The minimum order is 4 hours. Time over 8 hours a day is charged with a surcharge.

services.title: OUR SERVICES
services.subtitle: Translation agency Translators.uz offers the following types of interpreting :

1.title: Simultaneous Interpreting
1.text: Simultaneous interpreting is a mode of interpreting in which the speaker makes a speech and the interpreter reformulates the speech into a language his audience understands at the same time (or simultaneously).

2.title: Consecutive Interpreting
2.text: Consecutive interpreting is a mode of interpreting in which the speaker makes a speech (or says a few sentences) whilst the interpreter takes notes. The interpreter then reproduces what the speaker has said for the audience.

3.title: Guide /Travel Interpreting
3.text: Guide/ travel Interpreting Interpreters in tourist destinations will be able to provide international travelers with education and a deeper understanding of the places they visit. Being familiar with the culture of travelers also offers a more personal connection to the places they visit.

4.title: Whisper Interpreting
4.text: Whisper interpreting (also known as chuchotage) is used when a full audio setup for simultaneous interpreting is not available, and the interpreter listens to the presenter by ear, and then whispers the translation to an attendee, so that their voice does not impact the presentation.

5.title: Scheduled Telephone Interpreting
5.text: Over-the-phone interpreting (OPI) is a service that falls under the Remote Interpreting Services that some translation and interpretation companies offer to different organizations. Instead of interpreting face-to-face, a phone interpreter, as the term implies, is available to provide language services over the phone. The interpreter may be in another room in the same building or any location.
